intro: Ceraia tricuspis, commonly known as the three-lobed sea snail, is a species of sea snail in the family Tornidae. It is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed shell, which provides structural support and protection. The shell is typically smooth and has a spiral pattern, with a thick and heavy structure. This species is found in marine environments, particularly in the Indo-Pacific region. Its habitat includes rocky shores and shallow waters where it can be found feeding on algae and detritus.
